file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 36-20-02-04 - CONFIG-1 - THERMAL SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL THERMAL SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the thermal switches of the Bleed Air System. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 36-20-02-000-801-A THERMAL SWITCHES - REMOVAL EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 36-20-02-400-801-A THERMAL SWITCHES - INSTALLATION EMB-145 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 36-20-02 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-20-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. THERMAL SWITCHES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the thermal switches of the Bleed Air System. (2) This task is applicable to the thermal switches installed near each point of connection of the bleed air ducts. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-05/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - REMOVAL REAR ELECTRONIC-COMPARTMENT DOOR - RE- AMM TASK 52-44-01-000-801-A/400 MOVAL AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - RE- AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400 MOVAL LATERAL WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - REMOV- AMM TASK 53-04-20-000-801-A/400 AL AMM TASK 53-04-30-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 55-34-00-000-801-A/400 DORSAL FIN - REMOVAL AMM TASK 55-35-00-000-801-A/400 VERTICAL-STABILIZER LEADING EDGE - REMOVAL C. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 271 271BLW Inside baggage compartment 272 272DR In the aft electronic compartment Floor panel of the baggage compart- 272 272AF ment Floor panel of the baggage compart- 272 272BF ment 272 272CRW Inside baggage compartment 320 322 Dorsal Fin 320 323 Vertical Stabilizer Leading Edge 414 414DB LH pylon 424 424DB RH pylon 813 813 Baggage compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Soldering Iron - 30 W To disconnect electrical terminals available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Location of installation of the thermal 1 Does the task switch I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-010-B (1) Make sure that, on the overhead panel, the BLEED 1, APU BLEED, and BLEED 2 push-button are not pushed and the bar lights are on. (2) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach DO- NOT-CLOSE tags to them: • DAU 2A (Location tip: DC BUS 1/ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/EICAS DAU 2A). • DAU 2B (Location tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/EICAS DAU 2B). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 36-20-02 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove access panel 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 and AMM TASK 52-44-01-000-801-A/400). (4) Open baggage compartment door 813 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100). (5) Remove sidewall linings 271BLW and 272CRW ( AMM MPP 06-41-05/100 and AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400). (6) Remove floor panels 271AF, 271BF,272AF, and 272BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400), 261BF, 261DF, 262AF, 262BF, and 262CF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400), as applicable. (7) Remove fairing193 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 53-04-30-000-801-A/ 400). (8) Remove fairings 194 and 195 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 53-04-20-000-801-A/400). (9) Remove access panels 414DB and 424DB ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100) (10) Remove the Dorsal Fin access panel 322 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 55-34-00-000-801-A/400and the Vertical-Stabilizer Leading-Edge access panel 323 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 55-35-00-000-801-A/400), as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-010-B WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE OR APU STOPS BECAUSE OF THE HIGH BLEED-AIR TEMPERATURE. (1) For thermal switch P/N M1-195-xxxxxx, do as follow; refer to (Figure 401), DET B: (a) Remove the screws (4) and the washers (3). (b) Remove the sealant (6). (c) If applicable, release the bonding jumper (5). (d) Disconnect the electrical wire (2) with a soldering iron. (e) Remove the thermal switch (1). (2) For thermal switch P/N 11041-xxxx, do as follow; refer to (Figure 402), DET. B: (a) Release the screws (7) and the washers (6). (b) If applicable, release the bonding jumper (5). (c) Cut the electric wire (1) near the splice (2) to disconnect it from the electric wire (3). (d) Cut the electric wire (9) near the splice (10) to disconnect it from the electric wire (11). (e) Remove the thermal switch (8). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 36-20-02 Page 4 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR THERMAL SWITCH P/N M1-195-xxxxxx Thermal Switches - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 250/260 270/300 DET. A 2. ELECTRICAL WIRE 4. SCREW 6. SEALANT PROTECTION SUPPORT SLEEVE 3. WASHERS 5. BONDING JUMPER 1. THERMAL SWITCH 1 LEAK AIR FLOW DIRECTION 4. SCREW 3. WASHERS DET. C C DET. B 1 MAKE SURE THAT THE OPENING OF THE PROTECTION SLEEVE OVERLAPPING IS TURNED TOTHE THERMAL SWITCHES USED TO DETECT BLEED-AIR LEAKAGE. A PROTECTION SLEEVE 1 LEAK AIR FLOW DIRECTION 1. ELECTRIC WIRE C 11. ELECTRIC 2. SPLICE WIRE DET. B 3. ELECTRIC (TYPICAL) 10. SPLICE WIRE 9. ELECTRIC WIRE 4. SEALANT SUPPORT 5. BONDING 8. THERMAL SWITCH JUMPER DET. C 7. SCREW (2) 6. WASHERS (2) 1 MAKE SURE THAT THE OPENING OF THE PROTECTION SLEEVE OVERLAPPING IS TURNED TOTHE THERMAL SWITCHES USED TO DETECT BLEED-AIR LEAKAGE. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-20-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 3. THERMAL SWITCHES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to install the thermal switches of the Bleed Air System. (2) This task is applicable to the thermal switches installed near each point of connection of the bleed air ducts. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-05/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 36-20-02-700-801-A/500 - AMM TASK 36-20-02-700-802-A/500 - REAR ELECTRONIC-COMPARTMENT DOOR - IN- AMM TASK 52-44-01-400-801-A/400 STALLATION AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - IN- AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400 STALLATION LATERAL WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - INSTAL- AMM TASK 53-04-20-400-801-A/400 LATION AMM TASK 53-04-30-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 55-34-00-400-801-A/400 DORSAL FIN - INSTALLATION VERTICAL-STABILIZER LEADING EDGE - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 55-35-00-400-801-A/400 TION WM 20-21-00/2 - C. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Soldering Iron - 30 W To disconnect electrical terminals available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) TT-S-00230 Sealant RTV 780 AR MIL-S-81824 Splice AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Location of installation of the thermal 1 Does the task switch EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 36-20-02 Page 8 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-009-B (1) For thermal switch P/N M1-195-xxxxxx, do as follow; refer to (Figure 401), DET B: (a) Connect the electric wire (2) with a soldering iron. (b) Apply sealant (6) to the electric terminals. (c) If applicable, attach the bonding jumper (5). (d) Install the thermal switch (1) and tighten the screws (4) and washers (3). (2) For thermal switch P/N 11041-xxxx, do as follow; refer to (Figure 402), DET. B: (a) Connect the electric wire (1) to the electric wire (3) with a splice (2) (WM 20-21-00/2). NOTE: Cut the electric wire (3) to the correct length. (b) Connect the electric wire (9) to the electric wire (11) with a splice (10) (WM 20-21-00/2). NOTE: Cut the electric wire (11) to the correct length. (c) Apply sealant (4) to the electric terminals. (d) If applicable, attach the bonding jumper (5). (e) Install the thermal switch (8) and tighten the screws (7) and washers (6). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-009-B (1) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags from them: • DAU 2A (Location tip: DC BUS 1/ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/EICAS DAU 2A). • DAU 2B (Location tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/EICAS DAU 2B). (2) Do the Thermal Switch - Operational Check (AMM TASK 36-20-02-700-801-A/500 or AMM TASK 36-20-02-700-802-A/500), as applicable. (3) Install sidewall linings 271BLW and 272CRW ( AMM MPP 06-41-05/100 and AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400). (4) Install floor panels 271AF, 271BF,272AF, and 272BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400), 261BF, 261DF, 262AF, 262BF, and 262CF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400), as applicable. (5) Close baggage compartment door 813 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100) (6) Install access panel 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 and AMM TASK 52-44-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 36-20-02 Page 9 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) Install fairing193 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 53-04-30-400-801-A/400). (8) Install fairings 194 and 195 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 53-04-20-400-801-A/400). (9) Install access panels 414DB and 424DB ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100). (10) Install the Dorsal Fin access panel 322 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 55-34-00-400-801-A/400and the Vertical-Stabilizer Leading-Edge access panel 323 (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 and AMM TASK 55-35-00-400-801-A/400), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 36-20-02 Page 10 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
